results.title: The Sunshine boys
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Ray Stark and Herbert Ross
results.brief_description: Adapted from the play by Neil Simon, this film version stars two great actors, Walter Matthau and George Burns, as the two cantankerous old-time vaudevillians who have been persuaded to reunite one more time for a television special, despite the fact that they hate each other. Also stars Richard Benjamin.

results.title: The Sunny south-west
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Industry and Commerce
results.brief_description: Travelogue which covers a region of South-West Western Australia. Has scenes of Perth on the Swan River and street scenes including trams. War Memorial in Kings Park. Rottnest Island, Yanchup Park, Green Mt. National Park and the Darling Ranges. Bunbury Harbour and its surrounds. Sleeper cutting by hand for the railways from hardwood forests. Albany, originally the major seaport of W.A. Rugged coastal scenes of the region of Calgan River and The Sterling Ranges.

results.title: The Sunny Side of the Street
results.brief_description: This video looks at the changes taking place in home ownership and rental accommodation throughout Australia. the desire to own their own home is strong in most Australians and places tremendous pressure on housing prices. with high interest rates, increased cost of land and housing, the Great Australian Dream is fast becoming a nightmare. Housing development does not reflect the changes occurring in Australian society and a fresh approach to effectively meet these needs is required.

results.title: The sunflowers
results.brief_description: Silvana Forlini traces her grandmother’s migration from Spain to Argentina then her subsequent escape from political oppression that led her to Australia.

results.title: The Sundowners
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Fred Zimmerman
results.brief_description: The Sundowners stars Deborah Kerr and Robert Mitchum as Paddy and Ida Carmody, migrant drovers who travel 400 miles of Australian outback with 1200 sheep. Despite their devotion to each other and their acceptance of the itinerant life, Ida and their son Sean yearn to settle down on a farm of their own. The Carmody’s own drama is played out against the backdrop of Australia’s startling landscapes; at one moment lush and green and in the next, stark and forbidding. This film is a a testamony to the keen eye of director Fred Zinnemann and the excellent performances of Robert Mitchum and Deborah Kerr. Based on the novel by Jon Cleary.

results.title: The Sun symbol in art
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford Productions, Bailey Film Productions and Paul Burnford
results.brief_description: Man has responded to the sun in various times and in different cultures. Included in this brief history is a sampling of works of art related to the sun. Examples include suns chiselled in stone, carved in wood, drawn in ink, and painted on canvas. Sun symbols by contemporary artist-designers are also shown. After briefly examining the method of organizing a radial pattern by combining several materials, the three important elements necessary in designing a sun symbol are described. Sequences are shown of fourth grade students creating their own imaginative and personal sun symbols - thus the concept of an object in nature as a source of inspiration to the artist is made concrete.

results.title: The Sun shines over Lhasa
results.brief_description: Documentary about the Tibetan city of Lhasa, its people, culture, history and attractions as seen through the eyes of the Chinese communist government since its invasion and subsequent rule of the Tibetan people.

results.title: The Sun pictures
results.creator_credit: Campbell Harper Films, Films of Scotland and David Bruce
results.brief_description: Features photographic portraits of the mid-19th century made by two Scottish photographers, David Octavius Hill and Robert Adamson, of soldiers, dignitaries, personal friends, Clydeside fishermen and the first assembly of the Church of Scotland. All were taken by means of long exposure in strong sunlight. Commentator: Aidan Thomson

results.title: The Sun is our star
results.brief_description: The sun is the Earth’s source of energy and life. Describes the nature of the sun’s rays - ultra violet, infra red, heat and radio waves. Discusses solar spots, solar eclipses, and the polar aurora, their causes and effects such as electrical storms and radio disturbances.

results.title: The Sun and the earth: the upper atmosphere
results.creator_credit: National Academy of Sciences (U.S.), McGraw-Hill and Lothar Wolff
results.brief_description: The Earth’s atmosphere is known to be a region of diversity with different characteristics at various levels. Describes the location and nature of the phenomena observed in the upper atmosphere that extends from the turbopause outward into space. Explains their importance, and provides a sampling of the techniques used in studying them.
